business.headline: Stocks to watch on April 15: Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDAKey stocks to watch on April 15 are shares of Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDA ICICI Lombard, ICICI Pru Life, among others, due to varied news developments and Q4 results.

Dr Reddy's asks several top-paid executives to quit in cost-cutting drive: ReportDr Reddy's Laboratories (DRL) FY24 annual report shows it had over 26,000 employees worldwide as of March 2024. That includes 21,757 permanent staff. In FY24, the company hired 6,281 people and spent Rs 5,030 crore on employee benefits,

Over 40? You might be first in line for layoff, says Bombay Shaving Company CEOProfessionals in their 40s, once seen as reliable, experienced and ready for leadership roles, are now being hit hard by layoffs.

Tycoons in turmoil: Indian billionaires caught in Trump's tariff stormThe net worth of Mukesh Ambani, Gautam Adani, Shiv Nadar, and others has taken a massive hit amid a sharp correction in equity markets, fuelled by foreign investor exits and escalating global trade friction. All thanks to US President Donald Trump's tariff shock.

Rs 2.25 crore lumpsum or Rs 84k monthly? Which pension plan should you opt forUnder UPS, the government puts in 10% of your basic salary and dearness allowance and adds another 8.5% to your pension pot. On the other hand, under NPS, the government contributes 14% of your salary.

BluSmart likely to end cab service, join hands with Uber: ReportThe company, which started out by operating electric vehicles on Uber's platform nearly six years ago, is now preparing to shut down its own cab service and supply cars to Uber again.

Investing or borrowing? Check new SBI, HDFC, BOI interest ratesThe latest rate cut signals a broader trend—savers are using savings accounts mainly for transactions, while putting the rest in fixed deposits for better returns.

Mehul Choksi arrested in Belgium: What is the Rs 14,000-crore PNB scam?Mehul Choksi once headed the Gitanjali Group, a well-known jewellery firm. Born in 1959, Choksi was active in the diamond industry for many years.

Bank of India cuts home loan rates for new, existing customers. Check detailsThis adjustment is expected to make borrowing slightly easier for individuals at a time when the RBI is clearly looking to revive private investment and sustain domestic demand.

What to expect from stock market this week? 4 key things investors should knowMultiple factors could determine the mood on Dalal Street. From April 12 to 19, investors will be watching crucial Q4 earnings, economic data releases in India, the US, and China.
Investor visits Mumbai slum, uncovers truth about 'Make in India'Veteran investor Shankar Sharma recently shared a personal experience that raised fresh questions about India's manufacturing reality.

'Shift to UAE': Kotak AMC MD Nilesh Shah flags tax loophole exploited by NRIsNilesh Shah has warned that high-net-worth individuals could exploit tax treaties with some countries to avoid India's capital gains tax.

entertainment.headline: Diddy pleads not guilty to expanded indictment: 'These are not new allegations'Sean "Diddy" Combs pleaded not guilty to expanded federal sex trafficking charges. Accused of exploiting women from 2004–2024, Combs denies all allegations. His trial begins in May amid mounting legal scrutiny.

Historic Blue Origin flight: Oprah Winfrey cheers on Gayle King's space journeyOprah Winfrey was emotional as Gayle King overcame her fear of flying to join Blue Origin's historic all-women spaceflight. The moment marked friendship, courage, and a step forward for women in space.

Harry Potter TV series: Who's been cast so far and what we knowHBO confirms casting for its Harry Potter series, including Nick Frost as Hagrid and Paapa Essiedu as Snape. The show begins filming in summer 2025 and premieres in 2026.

White Lotus star Aimee Lou Wood criticises SNL sketch as 'mean, unfunny'The White Lotus actor Aimee Lou Wood has voiced her disapproval of a recent SNL sketch that exaggerated her appearance with prosthetic teeth. The actor termed the parody 'mean and unfunny', suggesting it carried misogynistic undertones.
Salman Khan shares gym pics amid new death threat: Thank you for the motivationBollywood star Salman Khan shared new workout photos. This comes hours after he received a new death threat.

Alia Bhatt shares pic with her 'home' Ranbir Kapoor on their 3rd anniversaryAlia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor marked their third wedding anniversary with a heartfelt social media post. The couple, who first met on the sets of Brahmastra, share a glimpse of their journey together.

Fawad Khan, Vaani Kapoor reignite romance in Abir Gulaal's Khudaya Ishq songThe first song from the anticipated film 'Abir Gulaal', 'Khudaya Ishq', has captivated fans with its romance and chemistry between Fawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor. Sung by Arijit Singh and Shilpa Rao, the song highlights the themes of longing and unexpected love.

Katy Perry on why she sang What a Wonderful World in space: It's not about meKaty Perry joined an all-female crew on a Blue Origin space mission, where she sang 'What a Wonderful World'. The mission marked a historic moment with a focus on collective appreciation and future opportunities for women.

Akshay Kumar thanks PM for honouring Sankaran Nair: Kesari Chapter 2 is a reminderAkshay Kumar has reacted to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's praise for Sir C Sankaran Nair and his bold stand against British rule following the Jallianwala Bagh massacre. He thanked the PM for remembering Nair and acknowledging his contribution to India's freedom struggle.

Tu Mera Lover: Ravi Teja, Sreeleela dazzle together in Mass Jathara's first singleRavi Teja and Sreeleela dazzle in 'Tu Mera Lover', a high-energy track from 'Mass Jathara' that blends nostalgia, AI vocals, and mass appeal setting the stage for a box office storm.

Ajith's fans break into fight during Good Bad Ugly screening in KeralaAt a screening of Ajith-starrer 'Good Bad Ugly' in Kerala, the movie theatre became an ugly battleground. A brawl broke out between Vijay and Ajith Kumar's fans.

Jack Black's A Minecraft Movie surpasses $550M globally, breaks records'A Minecraft Movie', a video game adaptation is the highest-grossing film of 2025 so far. Jason Momoa and Jack Black are capturing audiences globally, causing fan frenzy at the theatres.

Sabrina Carpenter celebrates one year of Espresso, sells out special edition vinylsSabrina Carpenter launched a special 'coffee-filled' vinyl editions to celebrate one year of the pop hit 'Espresso', and fans can't get enough of it.

Here's what Katy Perry is carrying with her to spaceSinger Katy Perry is one of six women set to travel to space as part of the first all-women space crew. Ahead of the spaceflight, the singer shared a special message for her family and revealed things she is carrying along with her.

Madharasi: Sivakarthikeyan, Murugadoss's film locked for September releaseSivakarthikeyan and director AR Murugadoss's 'Madharasi' is eyeing a September 2025 release. The release date was announced on April 14, along with a brand-new poster.

Jewel Thief trailer: Saif Ali Khan, Jaideep plot perfect steal in heist thrillerNetflix has released the trailer for 'Jewel Thief – The Heist Begins', an action-packed thriller debuting on April 25. The film features a star-studded cast led by Saif Ali Khan and Jaideep Ahlawat.

Suits LA Episode 8 review: Harvey Spector is here to rule power game with Ted BlackHarvey Spector has landed on the West Coast carrying the same style and power that he exuded in the original 'Suits'. The catch here is that he's going to join forces with LA's very own best entertainment lawyer - Ted Black - for an ultimate finale in New York.

Good Bad Ugly director talks success with Ajith, shares key advice from Tamil starAjith Kumar's latest film, 'Good Bad Ugly', has become a massive success, with celebrations held in Hyderabad to mark its blockbuster status. Director Adhik Ravichandran praised Ajith for his humility and shared how the actor advised him to stay grounded despite the film's success.

Coachella cuts Megan Thee Stallion's mic during climax of star-studded setMegan Thee Stallion's Coachella set ended abruptly when her mic was cut during the climax, silencing her performance of "Mamushi" despite visuals playing. Fans were left confused and disappointed, but Megan powered through, showing grace amid the technical glitch.

general news.headline: $2.3 billion funding freeze: Trump targets Harvard University over defianceHarvard's USD 2.3 billion in funding was frozen by Donald Trump just hours after the university rejected a list of government demands, asserting that it would not surrender its independence.

Don't fall into trap: Mamata Banerjee's peace appeal amid violence in BengalAmid ongoing violence in Murshidabad over the Waqf Act, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee urged people to maintain peace and avoid using religion to incite violence.

US visas are privilege, not a right: Marco Rubio to H-1B, green card holdersUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned that US visas are a privilege, not a right, and pledged strict enforcement of visa laws under Donald Trump's rule.

Intent, intent and more intent: CSK's new approach under Dhoni finds the winCSK showed intent for the first time in a long time during their win against LSG as their losing streak came to an end. Under MS Dhoni, the players need to keep the new found aggression going to mount a possible comeback in IPL 2025.

Watch: Katy Perry's 'limitless' moment in space with all-women crewPop star Katy Perry and five other women experienced the thrill of being 'weightless and limitless' as they soared into space aboard a Blue Origin mission, becoming the first all-female crew to do so in over 60 years.

Mark Zuckerberg testifies in US court during first day of Meta antitrust trialMeta CEO Mark Zuckerberg took the stand in a Washington, DC courtroom on Monday, defending his company against claims it crushed competition by buying Instagram and WhatsApp. The FTC wants Meta to split up—an outcome that could reshape Big Tech's future.

PM meets Rampal Kashyap, his barefoot admirer in Haryana, helps him put on shoesPM Modi met Rampal Kashyap, who had pledged to walk barefoot until he became PM and met him. Modi gifted him shoes and urged everybody to channel their devotion into nation-building.

Kilmar Abrego Garcia: The US wants him back, but El Salvador refuses to returnEl Salvador's President Nayib Bukele refuses to return Kilmar Abrego Garcia, wrongly deported by the US, saying he lacks authority. A federal judge previously ruled that the government must return Abrego Garcia. But the Trump administration pushed back, stating that the judge might not have authority to enforce that.

Watch: Tanker loses control, flips on road while overtaking truck in BengaluruA water tanker overturned near Dommasandra on the outskirts of Bengaluru, in an incident that was entirely captured on the dash camera of a nearby vehicle. The mishap occurred within the Whitefield Traffic Police limits.

Pashupati Paras breaks NDA ties, says party faced injustice due to Dalit identityRashtriya Lok Janshakti Party chief Pashupati Kumar Paras exited the BJP-led NDA, citing neglect and injustice towards his Dalit party. He hinted at aligning with Mahagathbandhan if given due respect.

Encounter breaks out in J&K's Poonch, one soldier injured in exchange of fireThe Indian Army, in a joint operation with the Jammu and Kashmir Police, launched "Operation Lasana" in the Lasana area of Surankote.

Vanishing Daughters Part 4: Testimonies of women who have seen it allIllegal sex determination and unsafe abortions continue to plague Haryana, claiming lives and exposing systemic legal failures, while women bear the brunt of this gender-biased crisis.

Family ties, fugitive fortunes: Inside Mehul Choksi's inner circle role in PNB scamFugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi, once a glittering name in India's jewellery industry, was involved in a well-oiled family apparatus that helped him move massive sums across borders and hide illicit wealth through offshore firms and shell companies.

EU issues burner phones to staff visiting US over spying fears: ReportThe European Commission has equipped its staff visiting the US next week with burner phones and basic laptops to avoid being spied upon, a report by UK-based The Financial Times said.

Tamil Nadu villagers protest after receiving notice declaring land as Waqf propertyVillagers in Tamil Nadu's Vellore district were shocked after a notice declared their agricultural land as Waqf property, prompting fears of displacement and calls for urgent government intervention.
Salman Khan shares gym pics amid new death threat: Thank you for the motivationBollywood star Salman Khan shared new workout photos. This comes hours after he received a new death threat.

Waqf violence: Is Bengal becoming a theatre of manufactured crises?In the poll run-up looms the grim prospect of complicit communal polarisation, of one party stoking majority anxieties and the other leveraging minority fears

Why Mehul Choksi's arrest in Belgium may not lead to immediate extraditionFugitive businessman Mehul Choksi, wanted in the Rs 13,000 crore PNB fraud case, has been arrested in Belgium on India's extradition request. However, dual criminality tests, health issues among other hurdles may delay the process.

BR Ambedkar's untold stories: How a boy, denied water, wrote India's ConstitutionDr BR Ambedkar was once refused water because of caste. But India's most powerful reformer turned pain into purpose and went on to draft the law of the land. These are the stories in between.

Not just the planet: The climate crisis is also affecting our mindsWhile not officially classified as a mental illness, eco-anxiety manifests through symptoms such as helplessness, guilt, and distress. This form of anxiety is particularly prevalent among younger generations who are deeply concerned about the world they will inherit.

No one wins a trade war: Xi takes swipe at Trump's tariffs during Vietnam visitXi Jinping began his Southeast Asia visit in Vietnam, warning that trade wars create no winners. His remarks target Trump's tariffs while reinforcing China's image as a responsible global partner.

NCERT gives Hindi names to English textbooks, sparks language rowThe NCERT has stirred debate by giving Hindi names to its new English-medium textbooks, including those meant for learning English. Experts and educators question the move, calling it confusing and a break from long-standing academic norms.

Heatwave alert in Delhi-NCR as temperatures likely to soar from tomorrowClear skies will prevail across the Delhi-NCR region in the coming days, but the heat is set to intensify, with maximum temperatures expected to soar to 42 degrees Celsius by April 17.

sports.headline: Ravi Bishnoi defends Rishabh Pant for not completing his quota vs CSKIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: In the post-match press conference, leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi defended Rishabh Pant for not completing his quota of four overs despite bowling well in his first three overs against Chennai Super Kings.

Under MS Dhoni, the players need to keep the new found aggression going to mount a possible comeback in IPL 2025.

MS Dhoni reignites pitch controversy: Nobody wants to play timid cricketChennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni reignited the ongoing pitch controversy after their win against Lucknow Super Giants. Dhoni called for better pitches at their home in Chennai where they have lost 3 out of 4 matches.

Michael Clarke reveals where Rishabh Pant missed the trick to put pressure on CSKFormer Australia cricketer-turned commentator Michael Clarke mentioned where Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain Rishabh Pant got it wrong against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in Match 30 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Watch: MS Dhoni consoles Rishabh Pant after LSG lose close contest vs CSKIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: MS Dhoni consoled Rishabh Pant as Lucknow Super Giants couldn't prevail in their last-over thriller against Chennai Super Kings on Monday at the Ekana Stadium.

MS Dhoni is still the best wicketkeeper in the world: Michael ClarkeIPL 2025: Former Australia cricketer Michael Clarke said that Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain MS Dhoni is still the best wicketkeeper in the world at the age of 43.

Ramandeep Singh eager to be KKR's finisher in IPL 2025: Want to be a match-winnerRamandeep Singh has stated that he wants to be the finisher for KKR this season in the IPL. Ramandeep said that he wants to back himself and become a match-winner for the side this season.

LSG vs CSK: MS Dhoni surprised at winning Player of Match award after 2206 daysCSK captain MS Dhoni said that he was surprised to win the Player Of The Match award as they beat LSG to end their losing streak. Dhoni played an entertaining cameo to get his side over the line in Lucknow.

Rishabh Pant rues not bowling Ravi Bishnoi's 4th over after 5-wicket loss vs CSKLucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain Rishabh Pant rued not bowling the full quota of overs of wrist-spinner Ravi Bishnoi after their five-wicket loss against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in Match 30 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Fans praise MS Dhoni after match-winning cameo vs LSG: Legends don't ageIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: MS Dhoni scored an unbeaten 26 off 11 balls as the Chennai Super Kings beat the Lucknow Super Giants by five wickets on Monday at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow.

LSG vs CSK: MS Dhoni magic powers new-look Chennai to 2nd win in IPL 2025MS Dhoni's cameo in the end was enough as CSK defeated LSG by five wickets to claim their second win of the season in Lucknow on Monday, April 14.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
